mapper.sql: id, login_name, password, city, address, owe_remind, deleted, create_time
mapper.insert: insert into front_user (id, login_name, password, city, address, owe_remind, deleted, create_time) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{oweRemind,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{deleted,jdbcType=BIT}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})

insert into front_user
id,
login_name,
password,
city,
address,
owe_remind,
deleted,
create_time,

mapper.update:
update front_user
login_name = #{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
city = #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
owe_remind = #{oweRemind,jdbcType=INTEGER},
deleted = #{deleted,jdbcType=BIT},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update front_user set login_name = #{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, city = #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, owe_remind = #{oweRemind,jdbcType=INTEGER}, deleted = #{deleted,jdbcType=BIT}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select
from front_user where login_name=#{loginName} and password=#{password} limit 0,1
